channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SD

item.title: Report E-2024040224
item.description:
Report E-2024040224

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-12T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: SIOUX FALLS
  • State: SD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XSO contacted ERTS regarding a punctured tote as a result of improper loading. The puncture resulted in a 12-ounce release of ScaleBreak onto the wooden trailer floor and the concrete dock floor. The trailer floor was impacted in a 4’x4’ area and the dock floor was impacted in an area of 4’x4’. A Contractor performed a tote transfer and cleaned-up the release. The damaged tote was cut-up and containerized for waste disposal along with the impacted oil dry, rags, and PPE. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted.

item.title: Report X-2024040124
item.description:
Report X-2024040124

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-12T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: RAPID CITY
  • State: SD
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/27/2024 at approximately 1800, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 5061923 at the station location in Rapid City, reporting an undeclared dangeorus goods shipment. The package consists of one fiberboard box containing one plastic jerrican. The accompanying safety data sheet identified the contents as "Quik-Foam HP" and classified the shubstance as a flammable liquid. The package was not prepared in accourdance with IATA regulations, missing the markings, labeling. packaging. and paperwork and is being held, pending an FAA investigation.
